reviewText: Wow, wow, wow!  Watching this dvd just puzzles me why Rob went back to Priest, I guess more or less for the paycheck...but oh well, this release is just pure magic.  First off the Resurrection cd is included in this set, freshly remastered and newly expanded with 2 tracks from the Resurrection sessions (Sad Wings and Hells Last Survivor), both of them previously appeared on the Japan release and later as (uh-hum) live versions on Insurrection.  They make a nice addition finally on the US side.  There are 2 brand spanking new tracks Fetish and God Bringer of Death.  While they are powerful and fast, and have that trademark Halford scream, they appear out of place on the cd, because again, they are newly recorded, so the mix and sound is different from the rest of the tracks.  No bother though, they don't take away any of the majestic from Resurrection.Now the DVD is a real treat.  Halford and his band just slay for 14 songs, and 60 minutes, and you get it all. Halford classics, Fight classics, Priest gems (Jawbreaker and Stained Class) and classic (Breaking the what?...Let's break that Law! and Electric Eye).  The DVD is incredible and while it was heavily bootlegged for years, this is the official, cleaned up (video and sound) version, worth every penny.God Bless you Rob, you have done a superb job with releasing the Fight Collection (yes Into the Pit is a treasure chest!), and now the Halford years...can't wait next year for the Crucible collection.  Thanks
Title: N/A

reviewText: Halford Live at Rock in Rio III not only includes a great 14 song live set and documentary dvd, it re-releases Halford's " Resurrection" with the two bonus tracks God Bringer of Death and Fetish, both good additions to this CD. This album was in my opinion the Return of Rob Halford back to where he should be, in front of a band that has the arena sound and blazing guitar solos to match his operatic voice. Don't get me wrong, Fight had some really fantastic work, I own them all, but his voice never catered to the "nu-metal" sound as much. There are several Fight songs that he just doesn't blend with as much as his Halford and Priest Material does. I saw him live on this tour, and his energy was back as well. Pick this DVD/CD up to see a small glimpse of that energy.FYI: For a short while Halford made available the Live at Rock in Rio Radio Promo CD with God Bringer Of Death, Fetish, The one you love to hate, Resurrection live, made in hell live, stained class live, jawbreaker live. If you have a chance to pick this up, worth it is worth it.
summary: Fantastic Release of Halford's Return to Metal!!!

reviewText: This is the best vocal performance Rob Halford, as great as he is, has ever given! A knock-out! Only complaint-why only half of the concert? The other half of the double CD is missing. Anyway, the rest is SO good, hats off!

reviewText: Halford proves once again why he is the Metal God.  Im glad he returned to Priest and making those amazing albums again.  Remember though he is still doing the Halford stuff too, so no one need to wail about him giving this up to go back to Priest.  Can't wait for Halford IV.

reviewText: This is a pretty solid live performance of Judas Priest singer Rob Halford's solo band. Like the double bass drumming. Also contains a remastered Resurrection CD with bonus tracks, of which Sad Wings is a highlight. The set list is dominated by Ressurection tracks but also contains songs from Fight and Judas Priest. The crowd sings Breaking the Law at the end and they smash their guitars. Stained Class is a definate highlight from the set list. They basically just stood there and played. There is also a Ressurection World Tour documantary. A worthy purchase, but has limited appeal outiside of devout metal circles. The concert runs about a little more than an hour with end credits.

reviewText: I am glad that this show finally got released on DVD...It's Halford at his best, and he seems to keep getting better! Not only do you get the dvd but you also get a newly remastered version of "Resurrection". Hoping for a "blu ray" release....Highly recommended.
summary: Waited for this DVD for a long time....Awesome show!
